page.title: 09HOUSING CLAXBY/USSELBY
page.content: There are a variety of housing types in the villages including old stone cottages, brick houses and bungalows.Of these the majority are owner occupied but some are rented. The rented properties include those owned by West LIndsey District Council and those owned by local farmers for use by their employees. These are usually charged out at a low rent and may constitute a part of the farm worker's salary. The houses generally have fairly large gardens and most people grow at least some of their own vegetables. Any new development in the area is small scale due to the agricultural nature of the area. There are also a large number of farm buildings and barns. Many of them are built of stone or brick with clay pantile roofs.
